intro: Lotononis lamprifolia, commonly known as the golden lotononis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
